pullRequest.body:
The current docstring mentions `simpsAttr` in the very first sentence, but not `simps`. This striked me as odd as the former is an implementation detail while the latter is the actual useful interface.


---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10726467028/job/29746575843)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10726467028/job/29746576606)
I think the custom names like `toFun ‚Üí apply` has gotten lost - this is maybe the main use of the attribute!

Hmm, can we somehow make the examples more consistent throughout? Switching between MulEquiv and Equiv and myEquiv is somewhat confusing, and somewhat suggests that changing `Equiv` is relevant for setting up `simps` on `MulEquiv`. Perhaps we could use `MulEquiv` as the running example throughout?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - doc: Better explain `initialize_simps_projections`
